pageTitle: For Hoyer, a Balancing of Roles | The Office of Democratic Whip Steny Hoyer
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {12794=August 28, 2004, 10830=Called a "city slicker" by some of his southernmost constituents in a district that encompasses all of Southern Maryland and parts of Prince George's and Anne Arundel counties, Hoyer spent his teen years just outside of the District and has made Washington his workweek home since his wife, Judith, died in 1997. On weekends, he stays at his house in St. Mary's County near Mechanicsville, where Charlotte rolls in nearby marshes and comes home smelling like oysters, he said., 11947=Hoyer, who is seeking reelection in November, has represented the 5th Congressional District since 1981 and has been the House minority whip since November 2002. He has spent nearly all of his professional life in public office, winning a seat in the Maryland Senate in 1966, the same year he graduated from Georgetown University Law Center. Later he became the youngest president of that body in the state's history.}
